clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Ambient Noise on the Responses to Meal Ingestion
clinical_study.official_title: Factors That Determine the Responses to Meal Ingestion: Effect of Ambient Noise

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Meal ingestion induces sensations that are influenced by a series of conditioning factors. Aim: to determine the effect of ambient noise on the sensory responses to a standard probe meal. Randomized, cross-over study in healthy subjects comparing the effect of ambient noise versus silence on the sensations induced by a probe meal. Participants (12 men) will be instructed to eat a standard dinner the day before, to consume a standard breakfast at home after overnight fast, and to report to the laboratory, where the test meal will be administered 5 h after breakfast. Studies will be conducted in a quiet, isolated room with participants sitting on a chair. One study day, a noise will applied via headphones for 60 min after meal ingestion and the other day headphones without sound will applied. Perception of homeostatic sensations (hunger/ satiation, fullness) and hedonic sensations (digestive well-being, mood) will be measured at 5 min intervals 10 min before and 20 min after ingestion and at 10 min intervals up to 60 min after the probe meal.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in digestive well-being induced by the probe meal
primary_outcome.description: Effect of noise on digestive well-being [measured by a 10 cm scale graded from -5 (extremely unpleasant sensation) to +5 (extremely pleasant sensation)] by repeated measures ANCOVA (dependent variable: postprandial sensations scores; within subject's factors: noise and time; covariate: premeal scores).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in fullness sensation induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of noise on fullness [measured by a 10 cm scale graded from 0 (not at all) to 10 (very much)] by repeated measures ANCOVA (dependent variable: postprandial sensations scores; within subject's factors: noise and time; covariate: premeal scores).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mood induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of noise on mood [measured by a 10 cm scale graded from -5 (negative) to +5 (positive)] by repeated measures ANCOVA (dependent variable: postprandial sensations scores; within subject's factors: noise and time; covariate: premeal scores).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hunger/satiety induced by the probe meal
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of noise on hunger/satiety [measured by a 10 cm scale graded from -5 (extremely hungry) to +5 (completely satiate)] by repeated measures ANCOVA (dependent variable: postprandial sensations scores; within subject's factors: noise and time; covariate: premeal scores).

intervention.description: Noise applied via headphones during 60 min after meal ingestion
Headphones without sound applied during 60 min after meal ingestion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- non-obese
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of gastrointestinal symptoms
- prior obesity
- use of medications
- history of anosmia and ageusia
- current dieting
- alcohol abuse
- psychological disorders
- eating disorders
